notesStmt.note: Ish Ger (Abraham Joseph S. Grazziano): inscribed (folio 1r, 270v).Censored by Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1613 (folio 270v); see 50-56.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pesaḳim and Ḥidushim of Isaiah of Trani, the elder, on the treatises of Yevamot, Ketubot, Giṭin, Ḳidushin, Nedarim and Nidah.

collation.p: 34 quires: i-xxxiii8 (folios 1-264), xxxiv8-2 (folios 265-270). Marked by catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 14th to 15th century. Shelomoh: inscribed in a red circular design, folio 202v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Isaiah of Trani. Pesakim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1421.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Fischl Hirsch: purchased from him by the British Museum on 12 January 1887: inscribed (folio [271v]).
